Reviews.Title: “very good location”
Reviews.Author: DohaFiona
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel but more like a big guest house than what I would consider a hotel. The man at reception most days was excellent he is either an owner or senior manager. He sorted our room out early and offered us breakfast while we waited which was very kind on the morning of our arrival. Unfortunately the rest of the staff seem inexperienced and rather unfriendly. Great location, but small rooms.

Reviews.Title: “At the centre of all the "must see" places in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Tonythemonk
Reviews.Content: We booked a package deal with Cresta for a week in Istanbul and after reading the Tripadvisor reviews of the Celal Sultan we settled on this option. The hotel could not be better placed for visiting all of the main attractions in the Sultanahmet area and is situated very close to the main tram line. You will soon get used to the "daily calls to prayer" one of which is around 5:15 am each morning, but we were sufficiently fast asleep most mornings to miss it! The hotel staff are very attentive, helpful, and polite and the hotel itself is very well appointed and has a roof terrace and restaurant from where you can see the Agia Sophia and the "Blue Mosque! The rooms are perfectly adequate, comfortable, clean and have tea and coffee making facilities. There is also a fridge. The superior rooms have a safe, but if you book a standard room you will have to use the free safety deposit box facility adjacent to the reception area. The hotel breakfast was excellent and had a considerable range of options. We also ate in the hotel roof top restaurant a few times and were not disappointed. There are plenty restaurants on the doorstep and you will be spoiled for choice. A few doors from the hotel there is "The Antiique Gallery Restaurant" and each time you pass you will have to run the gauntlet from Ali who will entice you in for a meal every time you pass. The food there is very good, but watch out for some of the "extras" which are put before you, and also the multiple glasses of Raki which will end up on your bill if you are not careful. Also a few doors along in Yerebatan Caddesi there are two other excellent restaurants, "The Kybele Hotel & restaurant" and the Baran Fish Restaurant. Within walking distance there is also Sirevi and Amedros, both of which are highly rated by Tripadvisor contributors. If you wish to save some time and money and you are staying in Istanbul for several days it will be well worthwhile purchasing an Istanbul museum card either for 48 hours of 72 hours. You can purchase this a few doors along from the hotel at a travel agent. This could save you time and money and enable you to avoid queuing at some of the places such as the Agia Sophia.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful Istanbul home convenient to everything”
Reviews.Author: 706marylm
Reviews.Content: We had a brief 2 night stay here and wished we could have stayed longer. The staff was extremely friendly and accommodating, and the location couldn't be better - close to everything in old town as well as the tram to other areas. We had a small room, but were quite comfortable. We were served breakfast early for our early airport departure, and couldn't have been more pleased in every way. Just wish we had more time to relax in the wonderful lobby or take advantage of the lovely restaurant with the great view of the Hagia Sofia. We would definitely stay here again if and when we return to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away from Home”
Reviews.Author: Guiti S
Reviews.Content: We had a most wonderful one week stay in this cozy hotel with a most fabulous view of the amazing Aya Sofia Mosque. The hotel is strategically located in close proximity to the main historical sites with easy access to tram stop. This hotel is a perfect match to City of Istanbul...charming, friendly and flexible. The last thing I want to do in a place like Istanbul is to stay in a gigantic chain hotel that seems out of its place. Every morning we indulged in a lavish breakfast which was kindly extended beyond its hours to accommodate the late comers. The staff were most friendly, helpful and professional...everyone in the restaurant and the cleaning crew accommodating. We especially loved the toilets with built-in effective "washers". Already thinking of importing those to the US:)) I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who is thinking of traveling to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “it is my 2nd stay in the hotel, and i still feel like home...”
Reviews.Author: Nadine D
Reviews.Content: The staff (reception, restaurant,..) was friendly and efficient as usual, the rooms were clean, the breakfast rich and delicious. the situation in center is very convenient. I had the chance to discover the Celal Sultan hotel, it's a good combination of service and price

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and very nice”
Reviews.Author: MandTN
Reviews.Content: we have just returned from a short city break and we stayed at this hotel. The location is very good with easy access to the main historical sights of Istanbul. The breakfast was excellent and even though it started at 7.30am it was offered to us on departure at 7am, which was a welcome surprise. The room was spotless, but there was not much clothes storage space. This was fine for us on a short break (and may be why) but if you were on a longer holiday you would need more. The tram system is great and I would recommend a short trip quite early on just to help with logistics. All the staff were helpful and friendly and we would certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A real find....”
Reviews.Author: BKandCB
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Celal Sultan for 5 or 6 nights in June, 2011 and it was a great little hotel.....location couldn't have been better for exploring all the sights in the Sultanhamet, and, from there, it was easy to take trams to other areas of the city. We upgraded to a superior room when we made our reservation, and that turned out to be a wise decision as our room was actually a little suite with an adjoining sitting area....it was in the back or side of the hotel and quiet; we didn't care if we had a view! The room was all done in white and kept very clean. Breakfasts were generous and staff couldn't have been nicer. We had dinner one evening on their rooftop restaurant and it was nicely prepared.....however, there are many wonderful restaurants within walking distance that proved to be more memorable. We used travel advisor as our guide to dining and that worked very well for us.. One caveat.....we were with two other couples who did not upgrade their rooms and they were not very pleased. We would definitely stay at the Celal Sultan again. It was lovely to step off a plane after a long overseas flight and be greeted by a driver who took us directly to the hotel......gratis. A nice and much appreciated perk.

Reviews.Title: “5 days & 4 nights in Istambul”
Reviews.Author: Filipa L
Reviews.Content: Great location, great rooms and the staff was very helpfull. ask the staff everything you don't know about this country: prices of taxis (the prÃ­ce is not fixed; hours to dinner - at 9pm is already to late, etc...) We will recomend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: dave s
Reviews.Content: for once a hotel that really lives up to the reviews, it is as per their website within easy walking distance of all the major sites around Sultanhamet. The hotel itself was really "cosy", staff were all without exception friendly and helpfull, i felt that the help was genuine and the staff really did care about us having a good time in Istanbul. On arrival my son and i were upgraded from a std room which we had booked to a superior room, one word, excellent, cleanliness and housekeeping were impecable. To sum up it really feels your are at home from the moment you check in, next trip to Istanbul we will be rebooking. Only negative review but not related to the hotel was a reccomendation by a concierge to visit the FENER fish restaurant....it had no atmosphere, 1950s european decor, poor selection of fish on the menu (which was not cooked or presented that well) and without doubt was the most expensive meal we ate in Istanbul- avoid.

Reviews.Title: “home away from home”
Reviews.Author: GenieNYC254
Reviews.Content: The breakfast, rooms, location and price for a stay made this hotel a great deal. However the service provided by the staff made Celal Sultan feel like a home away from home. Concerige Cihan's recommendations for great place to eat was always perfect. I look froward to going back.

Reviews.Title: “second stay”
Reviews.Author: vera m
Reviews.Content: this is the second time at the hotel. and if I go to Istanbul again will stay here again- it is very well located, nice room, friendly people, good breakfast; I definetly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “very nice stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: cat2012_12
Reviews.Content: Nice welcome at airport and reception desk, breakfast very complete and very good, cleaning of oom excellent, we had a very nice stay and will go back again

Reviews.Title: “You can't get closer to the Istanbul sights”
Reviews.Author: dphunter
Reviews.Content: This summer we stayed at the Celal Sultan for four days during a tour of Turkey. The hotel was in a wonderful position within a few hundred metres of the Hagia sofia which we could see from our window. Room was fairly small but immaculate and perfectly adequate for a touring base. We worried that being so central it would be noisy, but there was no problem at all. All staff had some english and were as all Turks helpful and polite. Food was a bit expensive in the restaurant, but you are surrounded by good fooderies so again, no problem. We would highly recommend this hotel to anyone wishing to explore the central tourist spots in Istanbul ( my favourite city in the world!! )

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and excellant location”
Reviews.Author: michael51_11
Reviews.Content: The Celal hotel is located near all the sites,. Service and breakfast were very good. The suite was especially nice and beautiful view at night. Would stay there again when in Istanbul. The hotel shuttle had a really skilled driver who got you there thru all the narrow winding streets from the airport - safely.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly and helpful”
Reviews.Author: PCRH
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located right in the middle of the main attractions of the old capital. Everything is in walking distance. Nice rooms, a very good breakfast and very helpful service makes life easy for every guest. OUr family was always treated very nicely. Children are welcome!

Reviews.Title: “Ok”
Reviews.Author: Romuald78
Reviews.Content: Best thing by far about this hotel is his location - very close to Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Cistern, Topkapi Palace etc. Also the Grand Bazaar and Galata Bridge are at walking distance. Standard room is not very large, but ok, nothing special to mention about it. Breakfast is also ok. Staff is very polite and helpful. All in all a good report between quality and price.

Reviews.Title: “Avery enjoyable stay!”
Reviews.Author: sue p
Reviews.Content: I returned to Istanbul to celebrate a special birthday. The staff veryvery professional and helpful and made my birthday very special. The hotel is in an amazing location, All site very walkable distance! The room was excellent very clean and comfortable. I recommend this hotel highly and will return!!

Reviews.Title: “Celal Sultan Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: GreyNomads44
Reviews.Content: Overall we were happy with this Hotel and would recommend it. The location is sooo convenient. We would not consider our room to be spacious (the "queen" bed size seemed more like a double) but who wants to spend a longtime in the hotel room in vibrant Istanbul! Being seniors we would have preferred a more accessible room - although there is a lift we had to climb several steps and a full flight to our room - this would not worry younger people. We did have a small problem with the transfer initially quoted an exhobitant amount to pick up our luggage on route on the way in - a more reasonable amount was agreed during a telephone call from the airport on our arrival. Also we were able to get a cheaper transfer for outgoing (the agent next door) but which the hotel then matched.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: E S
Reviews.Content: We loved the location. Our room had a stunning view of the Hagia Sofia. Breakfast was good and the hotel itself very well appointed. The staff speaks English and was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Canadian visitors”
Reviews.Author: Duncan S
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice clean hotel that is well located to visit major attractions and is convenient to the tram system.. Rooms are comfortable but not large and the resturants are very good We have no diificulty recommending this hotel. The hotel arranges pick up at the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Celal Sultan Hotel, nov 2011”
Reviews.Author: GAUCHIER B
Reviews.Content: Well placed hotel near Istanbul Old City : quiet place and very close to the mosques, topkapi and Grand Bazar Very competent staff, good advice for visiting the city Rooms nice and clean but someones too close to kitchens Breakfast excellent and very rich

Reviews.Title: “Can't find a more convenient hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Judith B
Reviews.Content: This boutique hotel is on a side street very near the Blue Mosque and the Haja Sofia, public transport and the Koptaki. Its public spaces are elegantly decorated and there is a really extensive breakfast.Staff are extremely helpful and speak good English. There is a small restaurant and bar on the top floor which affords a fantastic view of the two mosques, a good place to have a night cap. Room was spacious enough, and the bathroom is well-fitted. The area seems safe for walking at night. Lots of restaurants and cafes nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: James C
Reviews.Content: This was our fourth trip to Istanbul and our second stay at the Celal Sultan. We were not disappointed. The hotel is superbly located in Sultanahmet not far from the underground cistern. The roof terrace has been altered to accommodate a restaurant with fantastic views of Aya Sophia. Staff (Aziz, Kerim and Ahmed) were very helpful, as were all the staff. Breakfast was good and the superior twin was excellent. Beds were very comfortable and a good nights sleep was had by all. The room was very clean, as were the towels and bed linen. I feel the stay was excellent value for money and would recommend this hotel to anyone. Jim C

Reviews.Title: “Well located hotel”
Reviews.Author: ambohare
Reviews.Content: Had 3 nights in this very well located hotel in Istanbul. it is an easy walk from all the top attractions of the Sultanamet - Topkapi Palace/Aya Sophia etc. Our room was airy and quiet and well maintained. Free fruit basket was a nice touch. Staff are extremely helpful. Roof top terrace has good view and was a pleasant place to sit and relax or read.

Reviews.Title: “Good location; Good Service”
Reviews.Author: RanaAmman
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a small boutique hotel five minutes away from the Blue Mosque, Agia Sofia and Top Kapi. Clean and very friendly staff. Breakfast is good and the staff very helpful. Chosing to stay in the old city when visiting Istanbul was the best idea my friends and I had. We enjoyed a few days in the new part but the old city has all the charm. When there is nothing to do; you could be very happy strolling in the open area that encompasses the three major attractions I mentioned above; enjoy coffee or an ice cream or just laze in one of the many coffee shops scattered all around and serve good coffee and food... otherwise, grab a hot sandwich from one of the trolleys and enjoy an amazing ice cream afterwards.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, staff and view!”
Reviews.Author: Emma M
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time at the Celal Sultan because the staff were so friendly and accommodating. Great location as well! It made our journey in Turkey so much more pleasant as it was our first stop

Reviews.Title: “Small but convenient”
Reviews.Author: Monky1977
Reviews.Content: I found the hotel convenient but rooms were on the smaller side. Also coming from Asia, the service expectations are probably pretty high and as a result I found the service just about ok. The reason why the hotel gets good marks is the location, its bang where all the historic sites are and therefore everything is walking distance. The rooftop restaurant has a lovely view of the Hagia Sophia....but with a new hotel coming up on a nearby site that may (or may not) go away. We ate the buffet which was small but very good. Didn't eat at their restaurants so not sure about costing. Other positives: Free wifi in lobby which was good and also we lounged around for some time after check-out and staff were quite ok with it. Overall, a decent hotel if you are looking to stay at a convenient place.

Reviews.Title: “Good central location”
Reviews.Author: IckenhamChris
Reviews.Content: A very pleasant hotel with helpful staff. Rooms on the small side but adequate and clean. Pleasant cold buffet breakfast. The rooftop restaurant has fantastic views - food good but it is cheaper in the many restaurants nearby but you are probably paying for the view. One of the best things is the hotels location in the old part of Istanbul as it is in easy walking distance of many of the major sights. Would certainly pick this hotel again when returning to Istanbul

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, friendly staff - would return.”
Reviews.Author: GAHCarshalton
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived staff very helpful and friendly. View from the terrace is spectacular, especially watching the sun set around the mosques with a good bottle of wine. We only breakfasted here so cannot comment on the restaurant, but breakfast was good. The location offers good restaurant very close by. Rooms small but very comfortable and more than adequate for a city break.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: sofiarom
Reviews.Content: We stayed two days at the beginning of our holidays in Turkey and two days at the end. Its situation was strategic in our choice of hotels so we were very pleased when we realised that not only its situation, but the beautiful rooms, breakfast and kind and helpful staff was part of the deal! of course the front desk wants you to have an evening meal there or use their tours, but you can very politely decline with no hard feeling. The food in their top restaurant was very average and quite expensive for what it is, but the views of Hagia Sophia and the Blue mosque made it worth it specially at night when it is all lit up! The hotel is near everything, the Grand Bazaar, the main attractions, Galata Bridge where you can take, on your own without needing a tour a Bosphorous trip of a Golden horn one. Hope to take my Huband and family next year, and back to the same hotel. By the way, the internet is free and works.

Reviews.Title: “A great central location to see the sights of Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: CityTrippers2011
Reviews.Content: Celal Sultan Hotel is ideally situated in Sultanahmet to explore the wonders of Istanbul. Close at hand are excellent restaurants, shopping and transport routes including the Metro & Tram all within easy walking distance.The Hotel staff were friendly and efficient with the room comfortable and well maintained. Even though the Hotel is in the Centre of the city it is in a reasonably quiet location. The free wireless Internet worked well in the room. The roof top restaurant provides an excellent view of the Haghia Sofia and is a pleasant location to relax on a warm summer evening. We had a great stay for six nights,with a comfortable soundproof room.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet hotel next to the Aya Sofya. Wonderful staff.”
Reviews.Author: NancyandTaylor
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a wonderful four-night stay at the Celal Sultan and highly recommend it. The staff is personable and friendly and went out of their way to accommodate us. The location in old Istanbul is excellent, rooms are charming, and the breakfast delicious. We were lucky and were given a deluxe room with a beautiful view of the Hagia Sofia. The bedroom was a good size and sweetly decorated. We didn't care that the bathroom was small, we weren't there to spend all day in the bathroom. The hotel location is perfect in the middle of the historic district. We went on the promoted day tour, but decided we would have been happier with only the Bosporus boat tour of beautiful Istanbul. Getting over to the modern city was easy, just a taxi ride down the hill and over the bridge. We met up with Turkish friends in downtown for the spirited nightlife, but were happy to get "home" to our quiet hotel in the sultanahmet neighborhood and get some sleep. We are expecting our first baby. Needless to say, the Celal Sultan Hotel is romantic! Thank you, TeÅŸekkÃ¼r ederim, Celal Sultan Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “will definately stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Trouter1
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel, location perfect for walking to all the major sites. Not expensive. Our room was delightful, blueish hues with a large bathroom. Double glazing was a godsend for those who dont wish to be called to prayer in the wee hours. Breakfast was more than adequate and varied. The only issue we had was with the "prat" at reception who kept trying to sell us tours.....he didnt give up over three days, until we finally told him where to go! (he needs to be retrained or flicked!) all the other reception staff were delightful, courteous and helpful. Bernard E

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service”
Reviews.Author: TerryGReston_
Reviews.Content: Unpon checking in, we were told that we would be very happy, as they had upgraded our deluxe room to a suite. They were right! The room was gorgeous, we had our own private balcony and the service was great. Most of all, we loved the location of the hotel: we were a block away for the Aya Sophia; two blocks from the Blue Mosque. The neighborhood was delightful - we quickly found a tiny grocer and choose our favoriate restaurant, complete with it's own guitarist. And even though we were right in the center of things, it was very quiet at night. The hotel has a lovely roof top terrace, where I wish they could serve breakfast from - but is a lovely place to have a drink.

Reviews.Title: “super location - rude clerk in reception!”
Reviews.Author: bearne
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights - hotel in great location friendly staff except for one annoying clerk in reception - when we arrived he took us to one side and spent a long time trying to sell us expensive city and river tours. He became rude when we told him we had an excellent guide book and wanted to do our own thing. From then on he was sullen when ever we had to make contact with him!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and great neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: eugenetina
Reviews.Content: Rooms - Very nice, small and cozy with all modern ammeneties. Staff - Friendly, good suggestions.... Area - Sultan Ahmet is a great neighbourhood with its proximity to the Blue Mosque, AyaSophia...... The breakfast was included, which is something I like. Hope to go there again. Nice view from the roof.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: Kim-Phil
Reviews.Content: We were booked in here for 3 nights but unfortunately, on arrival, were told we'd been double booked and asked to stay at another nearby hotel. On returning to this hotel the following day we were given a choice of rooms and selected one with a sitting area which was very comfortable and roomy. The location is ideal - you can walk to lots of interesting places or catch the tram to the other side of the river. The breakfast was fine although it tended to run out of the fresh pastries if you arrive towards the end of service. We didn't eat in the restaurant on the roof terrace as we thought it was pricey - set meals at â‚¬29 and you can eat for a lot less elsewhere although without the view! Staff were friendly and helpful. We used the shuttle service recommended elsewhere on trip advisor to get to and from the airport for â‚¬20 each way for the 2 of us which was much cheaper than the transfer offered by the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, friendly hotel in a perfect quiet location”
Reviews.Author: vanhelZ1ng
Reviews.Content: Once again the Celal Sultan hotel came up with the goods. Friendly helpful staff offering their expertise and advice on local tours. Comfortable rooms for a good nights sleep with superb room service. Good rooftop restaurant offering excellent food and views over Istanbul. Airport transfers if you require them too! Good central location for all the main tourist sites....Can't fault it.

Reviews.Title: “Cute and cozy hotel”
Reviews.Author: Layom
Reviews.Content: A very cute and cozy hotel with a good breakfast selection. Clean and quiet rooms, very friendly staff and good service. It is near to the blue mosque and hagia sofia and other places and the metro is near too. I loved the feel of this hotel. Wi-Fi connection is available for free and there were umbrellas for guests to use in case of rain. When you go to this hotel don't go any further. Good hotel in a good location with good price.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: RSXM
Reviews.Content: We were completely satisfied with the hotel and its restaurant. Breakfasts were exceptional. The only annoyance came as we checked in: the clerk spent a long time trying to sell us a city tour, and became somewhat rude when we would not sign up. The rest of the staff was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, don't look any further. Go!”
Reviews.Author: Advisor170
Reviews.Content: A wonderful charming boutique hotel. Only minutes from the Aghia Sofia, Blue Mosque and Topkapi Palace. 10 minutes from The Grand Bazaar. Room (standard type) was great, first floor on the streetside, but no noise at all. Modern small bathroom, beds and towels of fine quality. Breakfast delicious and enough to start a great day in this exciting city. Dinner excellent in rooftop restaurant with fairy-tale view of the above monuments. Staff among them Ziya, Hafifi and Yusun are a gem for this hotel. Special thanks for their warm hospitality! Easy to travel around in this great city by foot, tram or one of the many ferries. Will definitely return to this city and to the Celal Sultan!

Reviews.Title: “Four star pretender would have hard time qualifying at a two star hotel”
Reviews.Author: ssafer123
Reviews.Content: Granted there were robes and hair dryer in the room, which I presume is why they bill themselves as a multiple star hotel- But in three days we could not shower because they could not get the bathtub/shower to work. Doors were made of what seems like corrugated paper and bathroom door would not close. Furniture looked like salvation army leftovers and the floor which was linoleum was devoid of even a rug. Most disappointing. Service pleasant, but nothing exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: carolhills
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights and would highly recommend this hotel. Had a superior twin room which was very comfortable and clean. The breakfast was good and the staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The location was perfect with all the attractions of the old town of Sultanahmet right on our doorstep. It was in a smalll side street and very quiet. The tram system was closeby and was very cheap and easy to get around on. I would strongly recommend it to anyone and will book to stay there again on my next visit to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “ENCHANTING”
Reviews.Author: cova_rr
Reviews.Content: Beutifull hotel....amazying location....you feel right at home with a very enchantng warm decoration....the service is impecable....the restaurant at the top terrace is absolutly magic with an increible view of the St.Sofia and Blue Mosque...great breakfast buffet!..definetly worth it...totally recomendable...and if you book with enought time...too cheap to be true!..

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service.”
Reviews.Author: Northern_italophile
Reviews.Content: This boutique hotel couldn't have been better located - a few minutes from all of the important sites in Sultanahmet, but on a quiet side road. The quality of service here is excellent - everyone went out of their way to be helpful - and the hotel is a pleasant oasis amidst the hassle of Istanbul. I'd also recommend the hotel's airport transfer service. The room, it has to be said, was quite small for a "superior" room although there was a great view of Aya Sofia from a (tiny) window. The bathroom was about the smallest I have ever experienced, even in a budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the best!!”
Reviews.Author: jpindenver
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in a great location with great people! We were there for a week and had a wonderful experience. The rooms are small, but Istanbul is a city! The breakfast is amazing--anything you could want and much, much more! The staff is friendly and helpful! They were great in suggesting day trips that worked out very well. You will be in the center of the Old City--SHORT walks to everything and a short metro ride to the Spice Bazaar. Would certainly recommend and go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: pepsi1924
Reviews.Content: We went to Istanbul for my 60th birthday and were upgraded to one of the suites, We used the hotel transfer service and although there was a bit of a mix up on arrival this was quickly sorted. The room we were given was spacious and spotlessly clean with the bonus of tea and coffee making facilities. The room had a fantastic view of the Aya Sofia, On the day of my birthday we arrived back at our room to find a huge bowl of fruit. We found the staff welcoming and friendly always offering complimentary refreshments. The sitting areas are comfortable and inviting with free internet access. The receptionist advised us on trips but was never pushy. Istanbul is a fantastic city with lots to see and do, don't miss the Yerbatan Cistern close by. I would definitely go back and use this hotel where the staff cannot do enough to make your stay a pleasurable one.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: nicholas47
Reviews.Content: Havng stayed in this hotel many many times, dating back 15 years when it first opened, I can't give it enough stars. Staff is excellent, breakfast buffet is elaborate, and if you choose to have dinner alop the roof garden enjoy the scenery of the lighted historical buildings. The hotel has grown from a modest building accommodating a small number of guests to a 52 room hotel. Clean, centally located and safe. What more could you ask. If you are bent on spending your money in a fancy 5 star hotel, inconvient location across the Galata Bridge, and spending precious time traveling by taxi through heavy traffic, then go somewhere else like London they have the underground. Enjoy the culture, the people, the food, and blend in for moments you will never forget. It's Turkey not New York.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyable and pleasure to stay”
Reviews.Author: ahmedz786
Reviews.Content: This hotel staff made our stay enjoyable and pleasent, staff are polite,efficient and helpful. Hotel itself is very clean and good location to various interesting sites in istanbul. Breakfast was good and have plenty time to enjoy.. Rooms are cleaned every day and found no problem

Reviews.Title: “Small friendly hotel with great service.”
Reviews.Author: Alex1522
Reviews.Content: We had exceptional service at this small friendly hotel. Arriving at 10.00 we were given a complimentary breakfast and access to the room early as soon as it was available. The staff went out of their way to assist and made this a memorable stay. we were there for 3 nights and I would definitely go back and recommend it as a place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A haven in the bustle of Istanbul Old town”
Reviews.Author: GullyFoyle
Reviews.Content: We have been coming to the Celal Sultan Hotel for the last three years. The friendly hotel is right in the centre of the old part of Istanbul, minutes from Sultan Ahmet and Agia Sofia and Topkapi Palace. It is tucked away in a side street, very quiet and comfortable. Two or three of the old city houses have been knocked together and fitted out with a lot of taste into a cosy, stylish little hotel. The rooms are all nicely furnished with antique and modern furniture, mod coms like shower, satellite television, mini bar and teakettle, Internet access is available in the lounge. The breakfast in the hotel is outstanding and really sets you up for a day of sightseeing. The hotel has a beautiful roof restaurant and bar with views over Aya Sofia and Sultan Ahmet, especially recommended in summertime. For a quick aperitif before dinner there is also a cosy bar at street level. In the three years we have been coming the staff of the hotel hasnâ€™t changed. We take that as a good sign. Very friendly and helpful people working in the hotel who will tell you whatâ€™s to see and where to eat and if you want to know where the locals go to eat. We highly recommend this little gem in the heart of Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel-location”
Reviews.Author: patty1951
Reviews.Content: Just returned from staying at the Sutlan. It's was a great little hotel, with a fantastic location. We had a de lux room, and it was spacious, clean, plenty of hot water, comfy bed. and a view of the Aya Sofia. The double galzing kept out the calls to prayer, which are lovely, but not in the early hours. The breakfast was not the best in the world, but OK. Very nice bread, cheese, jams, cereal, tomatoes etc, and different egg dishes each day. The tea in the urn was horrible, so took my own teabag down and used the hot water urn. There are lots of nice restaurants round about, but beware.. wine is very expensive. A bottle begins at about nearly Â£30 pounds. and Â£45 is common. The staff were friendly and helpful,and I would definitly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff in central Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: larsen80
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Celal Sultan for 4 days in November 2010 and can warmly recommend this hotel to others. The hotel is located in walking distance to great sights as The Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia and The Great Bazaar. Close to the hotel you can also find nice cafÃ©'s like Medusa & Kybele CafÃ©. The hotel's staff were very helpful and friendly and made us feel welcome. Make sure you request a double bed ad don't accept two seperate beds.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: lindacaus
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with two friends for three nights and I would have no hesitation in recommending it to anyone. Our room was small but clean and very comfortable. The staff were very helpful and couldn't do enough for us and they all spoke excellent English. The location was superb. You could sit on the terrace and look out at the Blue Mosque and the Hagia Sophia and all the main attractions are within walking distance. This is the type of hotel you would always want to stay in on holiday and I would stay again if I went back to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “great location, so-so room”
Reviews.Author: spry13
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the old section and within walking distance of all sites there. The restaurant on the top floor has fantastic views at night of Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque. Hotel staff was extremely helpful. Breakfast was fine. There was one free computer for guests to use. 2 elevators. Our room was on the 1st floor and had noise during the night from garbage pickups. The bed needed replacing: the mattress visibly sank in the middle even with no one on the bed and was uncomfortable. But those problems were OK compared to the location.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place!”
Reviews.Author: cbetzer
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights at the Celal Sultan Hotel. The staff was delightful and all spoke English. The recommendations they offered were all excellent. The only problem we had was the heater - we were unable to get it to come on when cold weather hit.

Reviews.Title: “If you are looking for friendly staff, clean, spacious rooms and delicious breakfast each morning, this is the place!”
Reviews.Author: 2BeeATravelbug
Reviews.Content: The Celal Sultan Hotel is located within walking distance to many of Istanbul's main attractions such as the Hagia Sophia, the Grand Bazaar, the Spice BIzarre, a Turkish Bath, the Blue Mosque, the New Mosque, the Basilica Cistern and so much more. You can easily catch the Metro which takes you everywhere for only 1.5 lira. There are restaurants, clubs, markets, shopping places everywhere nearby. The staff speaks many languages, provide for your every need, and make you feel special. They help you with every detail, suggest and set up tours for you and make you feel like family. The rooms, lobby and restaurant are non-smoking which is very much welcomed in Turkey. They have a restaurant on the roof where you enjoy a cocktail, good dinner while watching the sun set and the lights come on the Hagia Sophia.

Reviews.Title: “An old favourite”
Reviews.Author: JamJul
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Celal Sultan several times now, either on business or holiday. Overall, it is a great hotel, in a fantastic location. The views of Hagya Sofia from the roof terrace are amazing and the sound of the call to prayer from the nearby Blue Mosque is very atmospheric. There are some excellent restaurants very nearby (easy walking distance). Service is excellent, nearly always delivered with a smile, and the standard of cleanliness is very high. My only negative comments would be that the bathroom fittings are looking a bit cheap and tired, the bed I slept in was broken somehow (I couldn't be bothered to investigate) and the rates are a bit on the high side for what you get. One small word of caution, do not use the Daily City Tours arranged by the hotel if you are planning to do some sightseeing - we made the mistake of doing so, and it was absolutely rubbish.

Reviews.Title: “Only OK”
Reviews.Author: beegowhite
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based upon some rave reviews on this site but we were in the end a bit disappointed. Yes, it was clean and yes, service was mostly nice. Location is fantastic - no doubt. But the room we had was really small and lacked charm. It was also quite loud. The breakfast was horrible and the instant coffee a joke. The rooftop terrace had a great view but again, charm was missing. The waiter was slow and looked miserable, the chairs were uncomfortable, only some people received complimentary snacks, the drinks overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Well located and very functional”
Reviews.Author: naeplace
Reviews.Content: This boutique style hotel has a very nice ambiance. The staff are exceptionally helpful and courteous. The location superb. In my case they helped with advanced enquiries before I had even arrived. it was obviously a busy weekend, but the only time we saw a small inconvenience was the constant shortage of crockery and cutlery at the breakfast buffet 'scrum'. We stayed in room 308 - not recommended for light sleepers as every noise/footsteps/floorboard creak from the room above is very audible - not great if the other guests keep later hours... and check out early. The terrace is a wonderful haven for sundowner drinks overlooking the mosque and hearing the calls to prayer across the city. I would not hesistate to recommend or stay again, however, we booked as part of a deal with a major airline. I wouldn't want to pay the hotel's published rates though - don't think its worth those charges in terms of value. thank you!

Reviews.Title: “A return for our honeymoon did not disappoint”
Reviews.Author: bacs_1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Celal Sultan last year and were so impressed that we chose to return to it for our Honeymoon. A lovely, well appointed, hotel, with its own character, great location and friendly, helpful staff that make it special. Book the hotelâ€™s own car for airport transfers. A large, luxury four wheel drive vehicle, with a smiling suited driver for the same price as an Istanbul taxi! The rooftop restaurant serves great food. The view form the restaurant is good, although a little limited, by other buildings, in the direction of the Blue Mosque. We plan to return as soon as we can.

Reviews.Title: “Charming small hotel, excellent location, very friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: patandivanh
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 2 years ago, and the staff remembered us when we returned. The hotel is 1 minute away from the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sofia - the rooftop restaurant overlooks the latter. The rooms were very clean, the staff all very obliging and helpful. Located in a little side street, we would certainly stay here again, and thoroughly recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Very charming hotel on a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: alpaslan
Reviews.Content: Our group (8 women) stayed 4 nights at Celal Sultan a very charming hotel in superior rooms. Rooftop terrace (view at Aya Sofia) is amazing. Mr. Aziz Erdogan at the reception desk was very helpful , akilli ve yakisikli. He made our stay extra special. Also the transfer from and to the airport was o.k. Insallah bir daha gorusuruz.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, welcoming hotel”
Reviews.Author: Countrymum
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel staff to be charming, efficient and friendly. Always keen to help you make the most out of your stay in Istanbul. The hotel itself was clean and beautifully decorated and our rooms, although only standard rooms were clean and comfortable. The situation of the hotel was fantastic being close to the main sites of interest in Sultanahamet, also it was on a quiet street with no bother from traffic noise or pedestrians.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel in a perfect location to access the old city of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: jjpmir
Reviews.Content: Selecting a hotel for Istanbul was a unique experience for us as we didn't have any previous experience in the city but we knew where we wanted to stay. We started by using Google Maps to find the hotels in the Old City and after identifying six prospective hotels we started to search for reviews in TripAdvisor or in guide books such as Foder's, Frommer's and Lonely Plant. We quickly focused on Celal Sultan Hotel and when our friends who live in Istanbul later suggested the hotel as well, we knew we had an excellent choice. We called the hotel to discuss our stay and the level of accommodations that we were interested in. Please be aware that we stayed in "Superior"-grade rooms at the Celal, our rating above relate to that level of room. We have no experience with any other grade at the Celal. We found the staff to be excellent and helpful. Their english was excellent at all times of the day or night and their friendliness was warm and heartfelt. Like many hotels in Europe, they sold tours packages and we were very satisfied with the tours recommended. The breakfast was excellent and the wait staff friendly and accommodating. The roof-top terrace is unequaled in both it's view of Aya Sofia and the excellent service provided by both the bar staff and the restaurant staff (which is also located on the roof-top). We found everyone to be very gracious and kind to our 82-year-old parents traveling with us and we really appreciated the great service.

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Choice for Your Stay in the Sultanhamet”
Reviews.Author: Saavytraveler44
Reviews.Content: Our group included my spouse and another couple. We stayed 3 nights at Celal Sultan before joining a cruise on the Aegean. I recommend choosing the Superior rooms. Our room looked straight at the Hagia Sophia which was breathtaking when we opened our drapes upon arrival. Our flight arrived two hours late and our driver was there with our name sign. We were offered tea upon registration. Our rooms were comfortable. We prefer staying in the old part of the cities where we travel so we can walk around and get a sense of the history and people. You couldn't have been in a more convenient location. We were not disturbed at all by the call to prayer, but ear plugs should be part of any light sleeper's gear. We walked to the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace and the Grand Bazaar. The restaurants around the hotel are good. We also ate in the Terrace Restaurant which also has views of the Sultanhamet. The buffet breakfast was sumptious with choices for every appetite. We appreciated the excellent coffee too. We used the free internet in a quiet part of the lobby. It was hot & humid for part of our visit and our room air conditioning worked superbly. The public rooms were not as cool as we would have liked. We would stay there again without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect View”
Reviews.Author: Wolfwe1234
Reviews.Content: The rooms in Istanbul are typically small, so donâ€™t expect lotâ€™s of space. You wonâ€™t stay there during the day anyway, the town is too exciting. The place is just perfect, just minutes away from the main attractions and in a very quiet road. The service is excellent and the terrace on the roof is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Home from home in a Turkish setting in the very heart of the old city”
Reviews.Author: HiggleDiggle
Reviews.Content: A super little hotel, authentic decor and furnishings, located within easy walking distance of the major sights. None of this , however, is what sets it apart from the many other hotels..... it is the staff who are responsible for this. Helpful and kind in every way, going out of their way in order to assist us with th complicated aspects of our break. Always polite from the maids to front of house waiters and porters. The wide array of food at he buffet breakfast deserves a mention as does Aziz Erdogen ay reception.

Reviews.Title: “The Best for location, service, comfort & friendliness”
Reviews.Author: Kaifly
Reviews.Content: We have recently returned from a 7 day stay at Celal Sultan Hotel. I was traveling with my two twenty something daughters. We were picked up at the airport (very nice after a long overnight flight) and arrived at our hotel about 30 minutes later. Aziz, our contact at the hotel greeted us and after we settled in our room he took us on a brief walking tour of the neighborhood. And what a neighborhood ! Five minutes in every direction brought you to wonders of the world that were not to be believed. Bone tired and looking to spend our first night with a hotel dinner and comfortable bed we headed back to Celal Sultan. As we stepped onto the rooftop terrace at sunset we couldn't believe our eyes....the Hagia Sophia directly in front of us. A glass of wine, a bowl of soup and a selection of mezes before falling into our beds with crisp cotton sheets was our ending on a perfect day. Aziz arranged several outings for us and told us of the best places to shop and dine. A mention of the hotel's name gave us the best tables in "hard to get a rez" restaurants. I can't forget the breakfasts offered up every morning....Included in the room charge a huge buffet was laid out with food types that would make any world citizen happy. I will never stay anywhere else when I return to Istanbul next year. We are friends for life.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel in an excellent location in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Marianne_from_Zurich
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Celal Sultan in Istanbul for 4 days in late August 2010. Not only is the hotel conveniently located near Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque, but the rooms are clean and the staff is very friendly. I particularly enjoyed the roof terrace, from which one has an incredible view of Hagia Sophia at night. Any photographer will have his/her Kodak moment up there. The staff is very friendly and forthcoming and welcomes you with a delicious cup of apple tea once you set foot in the lovely lobby. The only meal I took at the hotel was breakfast, which was a very generous buffet (various types of breads, jams, butter, cheese, meat, cereals, juice, coffee, tea, Danish pastries, fruit, eggs and pancakes). I have spoken though to other tourists who stayed at the hotel and all had a good lunch and/or dinner at Celal Sultan. If you book your rooms via the hotel's website, you can have either the airport pick-up or drop-off free of charge. I chose the airport pick-up and friendliness of the driver and the cleanliness of the car all gave me an excellent first impression. This is very important to me, as I am a single female traveler. But enough, go and find out yourself, you won't be disappointed, neither by the hotel, nor by its location, in the heart of Sultanahmet district (= the old part of town).

Reviews.Title: “perfect for your trip in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: stancf
Reviews.Content: Good location - Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia. Friendly and efficient staff. Clean rooms. Reasonables rates.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Place and Staff...”
Reviews.Author: traveldeuce
Reviews.Content: Great valueâ€¦Friendly staffâ€¦Convenient locationâ€¦Clean rooms We recommend this hotel very highly! The staff was very friendly and efficient and went out of their way to be helpful and to meet our needs. The room was comfortable and very clean. We enjoyed the choices at the breakfast buffet. The first night there, we ate supper at their Terrace Restaurantâ€¦excellent food, try their lentil soupâ€¦and the view of Hagia Sofia was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “No hesitation in recommending this hotel”
Reviews.Author: MaryB05
Reviews.Content: I am a business traveller staying in many 5* hotels worldwide and can honestly say I would be happy to stay in hotels similar to the Celal Sultan during my travels! I have now stayed at the hotel on two occasions and the quality and service has not diminished in the slightest since my first visit in 2008. The front office staff were extremely friendly and helpful plying us with cups of tea/coffee when we returned after an exhausting day sightseeing. The hotel is situated in a most attractive area (see photo showing view from bedroom window) close to all the Sultanhamet sights. You will not be disappointed if you stay at this hotel

Reviews.Title: “highly commendable for medium prizes”
Reviews.Author: Mole58
Reviews.Content: The Celal Sultan Hotel is situated right in the middle of the old quarter Sultanahmet on the European site of the Bosporos. It is only a few steps away from tram stations. Sightseeing points as well as restaurants, cafes and Internet cafes can be reached on foot. The interior of the hotel is modern and comfortable. The breakfast buffet was rich and showed a variety of Turkish and Continental European dishes. The hotel has a restaurant. The staff was polite, friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, location and staff !!!”
Reviews.Author: JKAWASAKE
Reviews.Content: Since my first contact by e-mail, all questions were answered by staff - rate, location, tours to do...The hotel is near of principal places to visit: you can walk until Santa Sofia, Blue Mosque, Grand Bazar, Topkaki Palace...you have metro-tram 1block far from hotel...Staff is kind, helping all time. Rooms was ok every night. It was amazing experience stay in Celal Sultan because we saw the real life in old Istanbul. The next time in Istanbul we will stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, very nice staff”
Reviews.Author: PatManela
Reviews.Content: I have checked the reviews on the Tripadvisor site before making my reservation in Celal Sultan Hotel, and they were very precise ! The location is perfect, the reception people were very nice since the first moment I send emails and they nicely answered me ! The rooms are good for the price they charge. The full breakfast was very good to start our day ! I did follow someone's tip to have a dinner at Amendro's (walking distance from the hotel) and it worked very well ! Wonderful view from the top terrace, that is a very nice and romantic place for a drink ! I also could get a Brazilian guide (Nathalia) that was very good for us !

Reviews.Title: “Good value for Istanbul, centrally located and extremely helpful desk staff”
Reviews.Author: MarianG_18
Reviews.Content: The rooms are small and relatively spartan but clean and air-conditioned. The hotel is on a quiet street in the Sultanahmet district so it's in walking distance of the Blue Mosque, the Agia Sophia and many of other sites. The breakfast buffet was quite good and we found the front desk staff to be terrific, extremely helpful, all English speaking and responsive. Most helpful was Arir Erdogan, a lovely young man.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the heart of Sultanahmet !”
Reviews.Author: Tikalyani
Reviews.Content: I really recommend this hotel : Great location : 5 mn walks from historical sites and close to tram station, a wide range of restaurants around the hotel. The hotel is quite calm, bedrooms are big and clean, with all modern equipment such as mini bar, flat screen The breakfast buffet was good, you can also have dinner on the very nice terrasse The staff is nice, you can ask for all information you need.

Reviews.Title: “4 stars indeed”
Reviews.Author: emy77emy
Reviews.Content: Likes: - cleanliness, - terrace - service & personnel - position - architecture - room furniture Dislikes: - breakfast - room size First of all, very good positioning. Quiet area, cozy, warm, nice architecture, near Blue Mosque, Cistern & St Sofia. Easy & fast access to harbor & tramway, 10 min to each. Right across the hotel is a parking spot, 6 euro/ day - kind of expensive but worth it. The room - a kind of disappointment - small, no balcony. Despite this, very warm due to excellent furniture - it's a boutique hotel, a "belle epoque" style. And if your intentions in using the room resumes to a place to shower & sleep, its perfect. Otherwise, LCD, Roca sanitary appliances, clean & useful. And perfect price - 76 euro/ night. The biggest disappointment (but who knows? I'm a carnivore, the western guests might like it with all the cereals, sweet jams & fruits....) was the breakfast. Absolutely no meat!!! Pfuiii.... For sure not my taste. Not the worst breakfast ever (nothing can beat Italy & Italian hotels at worst... everything) but not even close to the best either (I've had even a better breakfast in Lucern, in a 2 star rated hotel....). I must repeat, maybe just not my style. Perfect service, perfect terrace, cleanliness, warm people. It's a 4 star & for sure worth it's value. And yes, despite my 2 negative comments, I recommend it. :)

Reviews.Title: “Top class hotel, in a central location and well worth a visit.”
Reviews.Author: lornajayGateshead
Reviews.Content: The Celal Sultan Hotel, Istanbul, is a GEM within this busy city. A lovely, central, hotel which provides everything required by the tourist or traveller. Good food in the wonderful terraced restuarant overlooking Agios Sophia, and courteous friendly staff. This is a well run clean and comfortable hotel with a touch of class, combining traditional and modern facilities. Quite a find in this beautiful city

Reviews.Title: “If you're going to Istanbul you should stay here”
Reviews.Author: arleen_hull
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 9 nights and the reason I would recommend this hotel is that first of all the staff are not only friendly they are also very helpful and informative, nothing is too much trouble. The rooms are clean and have everything you could want including a very comfortable bed, a great shower and tea and coffee making facilities, mini bar and of course, very important in the summer, air conditioning. One of the highlights of the hotel is the rooftop terrace which not only offers superb views over some of the most beautiful sights the city has to offer, it is the perfect place to have an evening drink(s) and watch the sun go down. The breakfast is substantial with a lot to choose from and food in the restaurant is also very good and dinner on the terrace is a real treat. On top of all that, most of the main sights are within a short walking distance and the nearest tram stop is only 5 minutes walk away. Arleen Hull Newcastle Upon Tyne

Reviews.Title: “This is a great place to stay in Old Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Horemhab
Reviews.Content: This hotel could not be more convenient to sights, transportation, restaurants, etc, but at the same time is quiet and very comfortable. Staff are friendly and very helpful, breakfast was great, room was comfortable and clean, good bathroom. My room was a single, and small, but I really enjoyed retreating to it at the end of a long day of exploring. I will definitely stay here the next time I'm in Istanbul and will recommend it to others. My only small 'complaint' is that there was not enough lighting in the room to read comfortably and there could have been more light in the bathroom for shaving, etc., but this seems to be the way things are in most hotels these days.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and memorable trip”
Reviews.Author: smily1970
Reviews.Content: Me, my 10 year old son, my 4 year old daughter and my sister stayed in Celal Sultan for 9 days. The service was great, the staff spoke english very well and they were very helpful. Beautiful buffet breakfast. Walking distance to all the attaractions. If I go back to Istanbul I would definitely go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: totoman
Reviews.Content: I went at the end of June at this hotel. It is clean, rooms are big, comfy, modern. The price is very good for the quality. The front staff of the hotel was great. But the best thing about the hotel is the location. If this is your first time to Istanbul this is really the place where you want to be. You can walk in less than ten minutes to all the major attractions.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasure”
Reviews.Author: Nut61
Reviews.Content: Although the rooms are a little small this is not unussual for Sultanahmet but what makes this hotel stand out was the rooms were spotlessly clean, and attractively decorated. The breakfast had a wide variety for a small hotel and the service was very friendly and helpful - nothing was too much trouble, plus the staff provided helpful information when we needed it. The location is also very convenient, with most of the major tourist sites of Sultanahmet within walking distance, plus the Metro and Bosphorous Cruises and lots of local eating spots. We luved the roof terrace and ended up having a night cap there most nights at the end of the day. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location with fabulous breakfasts and friendly helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: LindaJensen
Reviews.Content: What a gem. 2 blocks from the Hajia Sofia and the Blue Mosque; 4 blocks from Topkapi Palace. Walk up the street to a 400-year old Hammam. The breakfast buffet was enormous and delicious. Friendly, helpful staff; we followed their recommendations for restaurants and transportation. Rooms are a bit small, noisy if you are on the street, but spotless, efficient and worth it. Nice to be in a small, fully renovated hotel in such a great location.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent small hotel, caring service, excellent breakfasts”
Reviews.Author: Teachertraveler14
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff was very helpful with both the usual directions but also supporting our companion in a minor medical emergency. While the rooms are small, they are very clean, and the location is easy walking to most of the major sights. The rooftop restaurant has great night-time views and good food reasonably priced. The included breakfasts had good variety and excellent quality.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent, comfortable & friendly boutique hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: mjdtravel
Reviews.Content: Reception staff particularly hlepful in finding ermegency Dentist for one of our party. Also for suggesting places to eat, arranging transport etc. View from roof-top restaurant & terrace very pleasant. Hotel position excellent for short walk to Cistern; Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia & Topkapi Place Museum. Tram route close by. What more could you ask.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service, knowledgable staff, delicious breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Thelcp
Reviews.Content: The rooftop terrace was fabuouls with a direct view of the Hagia Sofia. the hotel is within walking distance to the old city, including the Sofia, blue mosque, and the bazaar. Almost every single staff member made us feel like a guest in their own home, with genuine and attentive service. Restaurant has light fare and full meals. Daily breakfast includes traditional Turkish breakfast-cucumbers,many types of fresh bread, tomatoes, cheeses, and olives, as well as a cereal, yogurt, fruit, and various cooked dishes. Free Internet made it easy for us to stay in touch with family in the states.

Reviews.Title: “beware steering”
Reviews.Author: theperipatist
Reviews.Content: Our room was remarkably small (couldn't open all suitcases at same time)--tho' this presumably a tradeoff for being in the very heart of the historic district. Breakfast buffet pretty good. Main gripe is their clear arrangements with certain other enterprises. They will pick you up and take to their recommendations. The first night was fine--the turkish bath a tourist only destination but quite fun. The second night I asked them for directions to a restaurant I had researched---one with reported excellent food in an old charming Ottoman building. The desk clerk pushed hard for their recommendation (as they had the first night when we elected to go to a small bistro next door--too tired for anything more ambitious. The second night--assured that this marvelous restaurant was in a fine old world building---and we would be picked up , we agreed. What we got was a brightly lit modern place, one of many circling this square crowded with wall-to-wall tables. We were rushed, food was mediocre--and the atmosphere high-season Coney Island. In retrospect, we should have stayed at more commodious digs even if a few minutes from the Blue Mosque. But if you do stay here, make your own evening plans.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, helpful staff, amazing location”
Reviews.Author: TamaraBahrain
Reviews.Content: My friends and I enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The staff were very helpful, especially the reception staff. The hotel is located in a lovely area, close to so many historical places and a variety of restaurants. Would definitely recommend it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Cosy and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: ZubaidaHM
Reviews.Content: I traveled with my friends and we all loved the hotel. The location is very convenient, within short walking distance of the historic sites and restaurants. Located on a quiet street which is near to the busy streets of Sultan Ahmet. The hotel was very clean, cosy and comfortable with excellent service. The hotel staff were very helpful and proffesional and provided us with a lot of information and guidance on Istanbul sightseeing. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking to visit Istanbul and I would definitely stay at this hotel next time I visit Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Super location super people”
Reviews.Author: TheBossEindhoven
Reviews.Content: Four of us stayed in the hotel for 7 nights. After a slight hiccup with the allocation of rooms, everything was perfectly arranged and to everyones satisfaction. The hotel location is super-central and the staff super-helpful, giving us answers to all our questions, and suggesting ways to spend a fabulous vacation in Istanbul. When we visit Istanbul again we shall definitely book the Celal Sultan hotel. Aziz and rest of the boys, thanks for everything. The boss

Reviews.Title: “It is a wonderful, friendly ,convenient , charming and located in the heart of old area.”
Reviews.Author: historyteacher11
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for five days . It is located in a quiet lane , near to a busy street of shops and restaurants of all kinds . Nearby , near the Cistern is another lane with many good and friendly restaurants . The staff are simply wonderful at the hotel and very helpful . There is a awesome roof terrace as well .

Reviews.Title: “superb service”
Reviews.Author: fun17
Reviews.Content: I forgot a valuable item in my room when i left the hotel.the manager has gone well beyond his line of duty in making the necessary arrangements to have the item shipped to me.furthermore the location which is behind the aya sophia is excellent!!quiet and rooms are immaculate......staff are responsive to the guests needs...

Reviews.Title: “Charming and conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: Jollynova
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at this boutique hotel within a short walk of the historic sites and restaurants. The staff at the front desk were engaging and helpful. The breakfast featured an ample variety of offerings in a lovely breakfast room. There was an upstairs dining area, which will no doubt be a lovely venue in warmer weather. The rooms are not large, but that appears to be a common characteristic of hotels that have been located in the historic area. The bath had been fully renovated and the bedroom nicely furnished. I have a friend who has lived in the Asian side of Istanbul for the past 10 years and she thought this hotel was quite a find.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location and overall good”
Reviews.Author: Frannie_Rules
Reviews.Content: perfect location, we saw the blue mosque from our room! the staff are very friendly although a bit on the pushy side at the beginning trying to sell us tours etc. the hotel is super clean, breakfast is okay but overall it makes for a very good choice when staying in istanbul

Reviews.Title: “Best service from staff in hotels during our months travel and we stays at more expensive hotels /”
Reviews.Author: Molkentin
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed with the service from staff friendly and great service a 10 . We loved the smaller hotel / one room was small but very comfortable & very quaint the other a new renovated superior room was excellant /breakfast was good / not the usual bacon & eggs buffet but we enjoyed / restaurant on roof was beautiful /good food /good service / views to make you want to stay / not cheap but not too expensive / worth it / We would stay again and have recommended it to friends

Reviews.Title: “Great location, staff, and property”
Reviews.Author: dlanor
Reviews.Content: Location: Couldn't be better, right in the historical core of Istanbul ... two and a half blocks to Hagia Sofia, Blue Mosque, underground cistern ... a short walk to the Sultanahmet tram stop (Also close to GÃ¼lhane stop but is an uphill walk to the hotel) ... yet is on a quiet side street. Tram very useful for returning from a long day out. Service & Staff: Around the clock (we arrived about midnight), courteous, very helpful (assisted in making reservations, answered all questions), multilingual, and couldn't have been better. Since we were there six nights, they came to know us and had our room key ready as soon as we came in the front door. Room: We had a basic room with double bed... European size. Bed comfortable. Room always clean. Marble bath with shower (hand & overhead rain style) and plenty of hot water. Large bath towels. Breakfast Buffet: Very pleasant breakfast room. Nice variety of cheeses, sliced meats, breads, cereals, yogurt, coffee, two juices, fresh fruits,dried fruits, etc. Kept refreshed. Overall: Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel, staff and location”
Reviews.Author: JACAMPBELL
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the perfect location if you want to explore the old city. You are minutes from the main attractions of the old quater, no taxis needed. The hotel staff were incredibly friendly and helpful and made our stay very enjoyable, offering suggestions, recommendations and organising reservations and transport. I would definately stay again with them.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff, excellent location, friendly atmosphere.”
Reviews.Author: Fiona6556
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Celal Sultan for a long weekend and it was excellent. The staff were so friendly and helpful and always had the answers to our questions (and if they didn't they found them!). The hotel is in a perfect location...5 minutes walk to the main sites of the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia and grand bazaar. Our room wasn't huge but had everything we needed (including a safe for passport/money etc) and was clean and comfortable. Also had a flat screen tv with wide range of channels in various languages. Breakfast was good with a wide range to suit different tastes and teh roof top restaurant has lovely views. All in all a lovely hotel and we would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Super Hotel in a superb location within easy walking distance of major attractions”
Reviews.Author: kruxty
Reviews.Content: Brilliant Hotel ideally situated for all of the major sights of istanbul. Cosy room with tea/coffee making facilities and nice bathroom with plenty of hot water. No bath but a good shower cubicle. The hotel staff could not do enough for you and nothing was to much trouble. The buffet breakfast each day was of a high quality with both hot and cold food available and a wide choice each day. Close to local tram which you can hop on and travel across the water for very little cost.

Reviews.Title: “Great atmophere in the heart of the old town”
Reviews.Author: Eirikviking
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Celal Sultan hotel for one week with my aunt and mother in the end of Oktober 2009. Arriving from Bergen, Norway in late oktober, is was really nice with a temperaturs above 20 C. Located in the heart of Istanbuls old town, Celal Sultan hotel was a perfect startingpoint to see all the historical places. You can view the impressive Hagia Sophia from the rooftop and also from some of the rooms. The hotel is just minutes away from the blue mosqe, Topkapi palace, Yerebatan sisterne and the great Bazar. From Calal you are also sorrounded with exellent restaurants and the athmosphere in the old town is really relaxing. We also tried out some good waterpipe-places nearby and the Cerbalitas Haman turcish bath. Both 5-10 minutes walking distance from the hotel. We also went to the new town and the Asian side. 2 minutes walk, and the tram will take you to Taksim, Galatabridge and boats. (If you are interested in soccer you can find a English pub near the Tram, with English prices though) I was lucky to get tickets for the clash between Fenerbache and Galatasaray. What a match!! Seated with the Fenerbachefans in the 3-1 win was a great experience. Thank you so much for the ticket Serdar Guzelce :)The staff was Galatasaray and Besiktas fans, and I enjoyed talking about football with them. We ate lunch and dinner out, but we found the breakfast really good. Not fettish and greasy but clean and fresh bread, fruits and vegetables. The room was clean and it was really quiet at night. I think we paid around 930 Euro for 3 persons for one week, wich is not bad for this hotel. This was my second time in Istanbul. The first time I stayed at a big hotel without charme and athmosphere. I love Istanbul and will stay at this hotel next time i visit. Eirik S. NÃ¸dland - Norway

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is out on its own for friendly and efficient service”
Reviews.Author: brodgate
Reviews.Content: We have visited over 45 countries worldwide and nowhere has the service matched this hotel.Reception was a mine of information all offered in a friendly and interested manner.Their willingness to help was so refreshing.We arrived at midnight and everybody was smiling and on the ball.Tours and hotel/airport transfers were arranged with no fuss and at good rates.Breakfast buffet had a very wide range of food both hot and cold .All was fresh and well presented with staff always present to assist inform and do it with a smile and friendly comments.We lunched twice in the hotel once in the bar and once in the rooftop restaurant.The food on each occasion was excellent.We had dinner on four evenings in the rooftop restaurant.Firstly the view was superb looking out directly onto the Blue Mosque and the Ayasofya Museum in Byzantine times the largest church in the world both of which are wonderfully floodlit.The service from Hafife and Ziya the two waiters was a delight with friendly inobtrusive conversation which left us at the end of the holiday feeling we had made two real friends.The food matched all the excellence of this hotel in taste in presentation and in variety.I recommend the lamb cutlets which were superb.Our room was clean comfortable modern with tea and coffee making facilities with supplies updated daily.The bathroom had a bath with a shower over and everything was emaculate.One day I had a reaction to some tablets I have to take and was unable to leave my room .I was overwhelmed with kindness and enquiries concerning my welfare and offers of help.Although the hotel is not large everything is done to make your stay unforgettable.The added bonus was its situation in the middle of the Sultanahmet.My wife and I are in our mid seventies but were able to walk comfortably to all the main sights as well as being near to transportation shops and restaurants.I really only have praise for this hotel.My only comment and its not a complaint,is that it is a town hotel so don't expect grand views out of your bedroom window.But then the view from the roof restaurant more than make up for that.If you are coming to Istanbul you could not do better than stay at the Celal Sultan.Its superb.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great service, great location”
Reviews.Author: pickoneforme
Reviews.Content: This is a charming, clean, well-run bed and breakfast hotel. The staff were uniformly pleasant and curteous and went out of their way to accommodate me. The rooms are charming, if a bit small. The location couldn't be better: easy walking distance to Hagia Sofia, the Cisterns, Topkapi, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Excellence throughout from Staff, accomodation & location”
Reviews.Author: StephenEdwards2151
Reviews.Content: We four friends celebrating our 45th Wedding Anniversary spent 6 truly splendid nights in this comfortable hotel at a very reasonable cost. The staff proved efficient friendly and attentive making our stay one of our best anniversaries ever. Free collection and return to the Airport. The location is most convenient for all that Istanbul has to offer being located overlooking the Palace, The Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia yet adjacent to a wide choice of restaurants all within a few hundred yards and a short walk to the ferries for the Bosphorus. A great place to stay in this fantastic city. If you want anything at breakfast ASK.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with friendly helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: slywin
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel through the BA website and all went very smoothly. My single room was clean and light and well equipped . The hotel is only a short walk from Sultanahmet tram stop so if you fly to Ataturk airport take the metro to Zetinburnu and then tram to Sultanahmet which will cost 3TL. I'm looking forward to going back in the spring/summer .

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel, a real gem, would visit Istanbul just to stay at this hotel again.”
Reviews.Author: NellLondon
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at the wonderful Celal Sultan Hotel. Right from entering through the front door, the hotel was an absolute gem. The reception staff were very friendly and most helpful helping us with city tours. The rooms allocated to myself and my travelling guests were of the highest quality and the breakfast each day was more than anyone could wish to start off a day full of sightseeing in this fantastic City. I would certainly visit Istanbul again, just to stay at this delightful hotel. I would recommend this City and Hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Beat that!”
Reviews.Author: Creaky
Reviews.Content: We took my wife's elderly parents (87 and 83) on their first trip to Istanbul, staying for the first 6 nights at Celal Sultan. The Superior Rooms were excellent, very clean and comfortable and no noise outside in the small hours! Breakfasts were self-serve, offering a wide choice of hot and cold food, juices,tea and coffee. Staff were friendly, pleasant and helpful, But the best about this hotel was its location, no more than 5 minutes walk from Aghia Sofia, the Hippodrome,the Sultanhamet and the Cistern. The nearby Tramway gave easy access to Karikoy and onwards to Dolmabahce and Kabatas; or the other way to the Burnt Column and the Grand Bazaar. . The "elderly couple" said it couldn't have been better--and we certainly agreed.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel in the centre of Sultan Ahmet district”
Reviews.Author: gerrard100
Reviews.Content: a good welcome from friendly,approacable and very helpful staff plus good breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location but mixed reviews”
Reviews.Author: Kate_Ash
Reviews.Content: The positive aspects are a wonderful breakfast and a great location. From the hotel the Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, Cistern, and Tram are all within close walking distance. Plus many cafes and restaurants, too. The view from the junior suite was fabulous of the Hagia Sophia. The negative: The junior suite was average. This room was not worth the price. No sofa or reading lights. Just two uncomfortable chairs. Two front desk employees were rude and totally ignored me. It was unprofessional. In the room policy handbook it said that no outside food or drink was allowed in the room. Never have encountered this ridiculous policy before.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: AucklandGreg
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in the Celal Sultan Boutique Hotel for four days and enjoyed the ambiance, friendly staff and the breathtaking terrace view. Our room was tastefully decorated, very comfortable and the Roof Restaurant was a gem, with delicious, fresh food served on lovely terrace. The Celal Sultan Hotel is a lovely small, charming hotel in the Old City district of Sultanahmet, close to many of the city's famous sites. We would highly recommend it to anyone who does not want to stay in the impersonal large hotels. Me and my wife will highly recommend this lovely hotel to our friends and hope to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Central, cosy, friendly”
Reviews.Author: Naghead
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel, located in the old city and within an easy stroll of all the main sights. Lovely rooftop bar/restaurant with stunning view of the Haghia Sophia mosque. Our room was a little small but perfectly comfortable. Friendly and helpful staff. Hotel driver surpassed himself on our last day. Not only did he get us out to the airport on time, despite the gridlock caused by the Istanbul Marathon, but he also managed to reunite us with our flight tickets and passports which we had left behind at the hotel! And we made our flight. Would certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect, adds to the Turkish delights of Istanbul.”
Reviews.Author: guyanaArab
Reviews.Content: Our short stay in Istanbul was a surprise birthday celebration for my wife, so i was relieved to find that the hotel that i had chosen was perfect.
