It's location in the center of the old city, a short walk to all the major sites,Decor, Ottoman style, was cozy and inviting, friendly staff especially Mr Aziz who helped organise our daily program so that we didn't miss the delights of Istanbul, not to mention the excellent breakfast spread, all made our stay a very pleasant and memorable one. If i had to make a criticism, perhaps the coffee could be a little weaker,, Thank you..

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: Carol57Priory
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right in the middle of the cultural centre of Istanbul. We could see Hagia Sofia from our bedroom. It was very clean, the superior double room was excellent value and had fridge, kettle, complimentary coffee tea. It was also quiet and the staff helpful. They pick up free from Ataturk airport and from then on one can walk almost everywhere that you would need to during a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location for Sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: fluffnfold
Reviews.Content: The location of the Celal Sultan in Sultanahmet cannot be beat--one block from the Haghia Sophia and the Blue Mosque, and close to many shops and restaurants. We booked one of the two suites in the hotel, specifically the one with the balcony with the view of the Haghia Sophia shown on the website. The room and bathroom were a comfortable size, with the bathroom having double sinks. Note that the suite has a claw foot-type bathtub, and while it may sound romantic, it is difficult to take an American-style shower in it. Although there was a plastic curtain around the tub, it did not completely close, which really wasnâ€™t a problem since the shower was only hand-held. The hand-held part did not slide up and down on a pole, so the only way to spray water over your head was to hold it there. The real problem, however, was that there was nowhere within the tub to set your shampoo, razor, or even your soap, so it meant popping your head in and out of the shower curtain to grab and replace the items on the counter. It was not the greatest setup in an otherwise good room. Looking on the hotel website now, it seems that the lower-category rooms have more standard, American-style showers with shower heads. Again, lesson learned from this trip to Turkey--the best (and generally most-expensive) room doesnâ€™t always have the most standard amenities that we are looking for. But again, location canâ€™t be beat! The buffet breakfast was nice, but I wasnâ€™t bowled over like some other posters have written. The front desk staff was friendly and helpful, but they did ask us several times about taking one of their recommended tours, even after we specified that we had hired a private tour guide for my time in Istanbul. They also recommended some restaurants that seemed far away (certainly a taxi ride) rather than places that we could walk to because they seemed to know the owners.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy hotel, great view from the terrace, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: mica_sirena
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for only 3 nights but I can say it was everything I expected. Very clean, great interior design, nice breakfast place and also good food; and of course great hospitality of the staff. The room was a bit small, but very nice and clean.It was a standard room, the superior probably is bigger. A very good thing is that the hotel is very very close to the center of the city. The terrance is maybe the best part of the hotel...absolutely charming view.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: lizzard44
Reviews.Content: The staff was wonderful, rooms pleasant and immaculate. The breakfast exceeded our expectations. We were traveling with 3 other couples, and we were all delighted. Rooftop restaurant very passable and accomodating for our large group. But the best part was the location--we could walk to everything. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, warm welcome and not a sleazy waiter in sight!”
Reviews.Author: debsywalker
Reviews.Content: Really good little hotel in a great location. Although our bathroom was dated, the rooms were kept very clean and nice touch of slippers and robes. The breakfast buffet was very good but the real stars of the hotel are the staff, nothing was too much trouble and they had lots of handy hints and tips for us.

Reviews.Title: “Celal Sultan Hotel - our home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Erik-Hans
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Celal Sultan Hotel a couple of times and we will be staying there again when we visit Istanbul later this October. The hotel has a very good location and a friendly staff. Enjoying their breakfast is a good way of starting the day and relaxing in the cosy lounge when returing in the evening is always nice. We always look forward returning to our home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: JaimeW
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Celal Sultan for 5 days this past Aug. The location is absolutely brilliant but we found the breakfast to be ordinary - we couldn't even get toasted bread. The hotel is down the road from the Hagia Sofia and Blue Mosque, as we were in Istanbul for ramadan, there were nightly feasts at the park near the mosque which we walked to every night. It is also a 5 min walk to the tram stop at sultanahmet. Our room was ok - we requested a cot - which they had in the form of a travel cot, our son slept well in it. The hotel also has a magnificent view of Hagia Sophia from it's rooftop restaurant. The only thing about the room was the noise - as there were parties every night for ramadan, on fri and sat night there was lots of traffic so horns were beeping at 2am. Whilst the reception staff were nice, they did try to sell tours to us and even when we said no they kept pushing. They tried to sell us a â‚¬65 day tour of the bosphorous and asian side, which we declined as we had planned on spending the day cruising the bosphorous (for â‚¬10 you can get a ferry return from eminonu pier) and was quite persistent. Then on our last day we asked how much it would cost for airport transfer to Sabiha Gokcen airport and we were told â‚¬70 - we walked to the Hagia Sophia and there was a guy sitting there selling â‚¬10 airport transfer tickets - so we obviously went with him. I would recommend this hotel for his brilliant location and decent rooms, but avoid doing tours etc through the hotel - you can do it yourself for much cheaper price.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: LloydNZ
Reviews.Content: This is a small friendly hotel in old part of Istanbul only 5 min walk from Blue Mosque. We stayed in two different rooms as stay was broken by a trip to Gallipoli and both were excellent. Staff were friendly and best of all it is a non smoking hotel in a city where everyone smokes even in restaurants. After one night in a smoky restaurant, we ate the rest of our meals at the hotel. The restaurant is on the top floor with an excellent view of surrounding area. Make sure you book for evening meal as restaurant is not that big. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!!!!”
Reviews.Author: appzr
Reviews.Content: That says it all plus clean as a whistle, breakfast spreads and staff very helpful. This is the mid price range place to stay for your first visit to Istanbul which should begin in The Old City, Sultanhamet.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem!”
Reviews.Author: carebeast
Reviews.Content: The hotel is small and adorable. It is convenietyly located to many sites and attractions and the staff is wonderful. I loved their breakfast too - very delicious - though I wonder if there is anything in Turkey that isn't yummy! I went on this trip with my dad who also had a great time! The room was a little on the small side, but very comfortable!!

Reviews.Title: “The perfect choice”
Reviews.Author: Hirant
Reviews.Content: A great little hotel right in the heart of all the attractions of Istanbul. Faultless service from the most genuinely friendly people we met in Turkey. The staff are very knowledgable about tours and transport options around the city and beyond. Smallish rooms, but very clean and beautifully decorated. Nice view of the Haghia Sophia at night from the rooftop restaurant. The perfect choice if you wish to balance price and luxury during your stay in this pretty city.

Reviews.Title: “great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: GandKFarnham_Surrey
Reviews.Content: Comfortable rooms, quiet, very central for the old town. very helpful staff, good breakfast selection. Great views from the roof terrace. This is a charming little hotel in a huge city. When we return to Istanbul we will look no further than this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Most charming hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: AntwerpenJean
Reviews.Content: The service was incredible, the roof restaurant was delicious, the rooms very clean and beautiful. The atmosphere was very relax. We 're definitly coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Very well located”
Reviews.Author: RMAG
Reviews.Content: Great location for the mosques and bazaars. Was here for for days and there was still plenty to see and do. Check out the underground water cistern just down the road - amazing. Lots of eateries around and about - strongly recommend Cafe Amedro - was in one of our guide books and was best meal we had. Hotel was clean and decent selection at breakfast. Our room was a bit tired but well serviced.

Reviews.Title: “No disappointments here - a hidden gem!”
Reviews.Author: ValPryor
Reviews.Content: After spending two hours reading trip advisor reviews on hotels in Istanbul I chose this one. Organising a trip to please all four girlfriends between 60 - 70 years, was not easy as everybody has their own idea of the perfect hotel. We were not disappointed! We loved everything about it - its character, quiet location (only 5 min. walk to the main sights (Blue Mosque, Cistern etc,) friendly and helpful reception staff who bent over backwards to make our stay a pleasurable one, excellent breakfast, roof top terrace and restaurant with good food, fantastic views and delightful staff. We had booked 2 twin bedded rooms but for some reason one was only available on arrival so two of us were upgraded to a junior suite where there was room to install another bed and all this was done in 5 mins & with a smile! The standard rooms are smaller than UK hotels ( this is the case in most Istanbul hotels) but they are well decorated and comfortable with excellent en-suite facilities. We stayed 3 nights specifically for sightseeing before flying to friend's house near Bodrum and had no complaints. The 'boys' on reception (we are old age pensioners so they seemed like boys to us) were very patient and helpful, answering questions on almost anything and advising us on best 'value for money' trips etc. Lovely hotel and excellent value for money. Would definitely return! Thank you Celal Sultan for making four old ladies very happy!!

Reviews.Title: “loved the celal sultan”
Reviews.Author: shalinik
Reviews.Content: I have to admit that initially when I was " coerced" into downgrading my hotel booking from the Marmara Istanbul to the Celal Sultan, I was very upset. However, it turned out to be a pleasant surprise......the location of the hotel was absolutely fabulous...located in the heart of the sultanahmet district, this little hotel is literally a few minutes ( 3-5) walk from the main attractions like the Aya Sofia, blue mosque etc...the grand bazaar, Pier Loti' s cafe, the amazing little restaurants, the arasta bazaar......the hop on hop off tour bus....... The staff is keen to help and courteous...Selman in particular was a delightful front office receptionist who charmed everyone around him. The rooms are neat and clean and not too small....some of the rooms have a nice view......well equipped rooms...air conditioned, and no, the prayer call of the mullah does not really disturb anyone....contrary to what I had read in some of the reviews. The breakfast though not very imaginative , was nice..... In my frank opinion ( and mind you I like my comforts of a 5 star property) , this hotel is worth every penny......STAY THERE PEOPLE!!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Hotel, Superb Location”
Reviews.Author: Darwen01
Reviews.Content: Date of Stay, 22nd to 26th May 2009. Friendly staff, clean hotel in a great location, walking distance to Blue Mosque,Topkapi Palace, Grand Bazaar, and the modern efficient tram system.The room was a standard room which was ok for what we wanted, who wants to stop in the hotel room with so much to see in Istanbul. Breakfast is continental and satisfactory. The hotel staff will try and sell you trips on arrival which is ok everyone has to make a living but we usually like to make our own way, however we did let them organise an afternoon trip on the Bosphorus which was excellent, you no doubt could get it cheaper but with limited time this was good value for money. Get up early if you want to avoid the crowds for the major sights. Would we use this hotel again and recommend to others, yes we would.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, modern hotel in amazing location”
Reviews.Author: ob12008
Reviews.Content: Just 2 mins walk from several key sites, great views of the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofya and Topkapi Palace from the rooftop restaurant. Room was a reasonable size (standard double), comfortable and clean, bathroom a little small but so well planned so plenty of space for your toiletries etc. Staff were extremely friendly, good tips on areas to eat (go to Kumkapi for fab fish and seafood) and breakfast was great. NB our taxi driver from the airport had trouble finding the hotel - tell them it's off Yerebatan Street.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT”
Reviews.Author: Katleen1982
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to Istanbul in april and stayed at the Celal Sultan Hotel for five nights and it was absolutely GREAT. Right upon entering the hotel we were impressed by their beautiful and rich breakfast. The room we stayed in was very nice, spacious and comfortable complete with all the necessary requirements. All the staff members of the hotel, be it the front desk, terrace restaurant or room service, were very very helpful and easy to talk to. The terrace restaurant was perfect for dinner at evening time when the dark came.The best aspect of the hotel though is its location. The Grand Bazaar, Blue Mosque, and Aya Sofia are within a 2-5 minutes walking distance of the hotel. In addition, there are tons of good places to eat near the hotel. All in all, my wife and I loved Istanbul and thoroughly enjoyed staying at Celal Sultan Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in very convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: Culture-vulture888
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel, well cared-for, with conscientious staff providing excellent service. Our room (a Superior twin) was smart, clean and comfortable, and the public areas in traditional style were attractive and welcoming. The location is ideal for exploring the Old Town's sights on foot, and close to two tram stops for reaching other areas and crossing the Golden Horn.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel perfect location”
Reviews.Author: yvonne-phil
Reviews.Content: Our travel agents were right to recommend this hotel. Everything here is delightful, especially the view from the dining room at night when the minarets of the mosques and the gates of the Topkapi Palace are bathed in coloured lights and sea birds wheel and cry around them. We stayed three nights so were met at the airport. Couldn't fault the place.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Bristollady
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here for six nights. The location in Sultanahmet was excellent and the views from the rooftop restaurant were superb. The staff were friendly and helpful, the room was clean and comfortable, the breakfast was very good and free Internet access was a bonus. I would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a base to stay in Sultanahmet while they visited the city.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location to see Istanbul's beautiful buildings”
Reviews.Author: DidleyCambridge
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a long weekend 27th to 31st March. Its a beautiful little hotel with lots of charm and appeal. We were greeted by very welcoming and fun loving staff, after a long bus ride, then taxi, from SG airport. The staff were always friendly and ready for a joke, although they do try and sell you lots of their trips (which can be found cheaper elsewhere) Like all hotels the restaurant and bar were very expensive, but if you don't like the prices eat and drink elsewhere like we did. We were a little disappointed with the size of our room. A little pokey (402) but for a long weekend it was ok. Immaculately clean and a lovely comfy bed. We slept like logs every night. Until 5am when you are called to prayer from the mosques nearby. But we loved that it, was slightly eerie but all part of the experience! On arrival we had a lovely basket of fresh fruit in our room. That was a lovely touch. Be careful also, as I got an electric shock from the socket in the bathroom as they haven't quite caught up with Health and Safety in Turkey! We had a private taxi back to our airport that the hotel arranged. That was really nice and much better than a taxi to Taksim square and then catching the bus. Like the previous reviewer I have to agree with everything they say about the hotel and location. We certainly had a wonderful time in Istanbul and would definately go back to the Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - A really enjoyable stay!”
Reviews.Author: SwissMiss08Uk
Reviews.Content: We booked our 4 night stay at the Celal Sultan hotel after reading reviews on TripAdvisor and were really very pleased with everything. The service the staff provides is excellent â€“ they are all very friendly and helped with all our queries and needs â€“ from advice on what to see to booking transport and posting postcards. The room was very clean and of a good size for a hotel in Istanbul. Even though our room was right next to the lift we didnâ€™t hear it at all as it was so quiet (this really surprised us). Although we didn't get a room with a view, the window let in plenty of light and fresh air. The heating in the room was great â€“ very easy to adjust. The bathroom was immaculate with a very powerful shower (great after a long day of sightseeing!) and ample toiletries. The only problem we had during our stay was a leaky kettle in our room but this was replaced within minutes with no fuss, so no complaints there. I thought the hotel was very tastefully decorated from the lobbies, landings and rooms to the two restaurants. The view from the terrace restaurant is fantastic â€“ you can see how close the Aya Sofya and Blue Mosque are. We ate there one night and although it was perhaps a little more expensive than other restaurants, the view was great, atmosphere cosy and the waiting staff was very attentive. There is also free internet access which was very useful for checking-in for our flights on line. We didn't use the hotel pick-up service as they quoted 30 EUR which is a bit steep (only costs 25-35YTL in a taxi) but we used the hotel transport to the airport (as then it cost the same as getting a taxi!). The friendly driver turned up on time and dropped us off at the airport smoothly (always a relief at the end of a trip). As we were leaving before 7.30am (when breakfast starts) on our last day to catch our flight we thought weâ€™d have to miss breakfast but the staff made tea for us and asked us to see if we wanted anything from what was being laid out breakfast â€“ all without us asking. Itâ€™s the small touches like that that really count. The buffet breakfast was excellent with a wide range of cheeses, breads, jams, biscuits, olives etc (more than made up for the lack of fresh orange juice!) The hotel location is superb â€“ the Aya Sofya, Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, Underground Cistern and Sultanahmet tram stop are all within 5 or 10 mins walk. We also walked to the Grand bazaar which only took around 15 minutes or so. The best thing for me was the location and I canâ€™t actually think of anything I didnâ€™t like (itâ€™s not often I can say that!) I would certainly stay there again and would happily recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location”
Reviews.Author: ElectricMayhem
Reviews.Content: On recommendations from this forum, we decided to try the Celal Sultan for our 6 night stay in Istanbul. We found the hotel for an amazing price online (only $40 US). Amazing value for the money. Rack rates at the hotel were 5 times this. Perfect location. Within 500 meters of the Ayasophia, Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace and Underground Cistern. About a 5 min walk to the very convenient tram which will take you almost everywhere you want to go for approx. $1 US. The hotel provides transfers to the airport, but the travel agent next door can get you a much better deal. The rooms were small, but very clean. Excellent bathrooms/shower and a flat screen TV. Good wireless internet throughout. Breakfast is served until 10AM every morning and is very satisfying. Overall a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place - loved it.”
Reviews.Author: worldtravelBerlin
Reviews.Content: We chose the Celal Sultan after checking out from another place which was almost the same price but much less value. The Celal Sultan has an excellent location (close to Hagia Sophia), with fantastic views from the terrace to Hagia Sophia. The rooms (superior) are very well equipped, well sized, and excellently maintained. Service quality is superb, breakfast very good. If you can afford it, book it.

Reviews.Title: “Apology To The Celal Sultan Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Popogranny
Reviews.Content: I thought the hotel staff stole my sony camcorder. It turned out that the crew members from Oceania had taken my camcorder from my room the morning we were disembarking. My apologies to the hotel for thinking that it was the Hotel's doing.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect realxation”
Reviews.Author: Raystravels
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in room 215 (Superior Room) which had dressing gowns, slippers, flat screen tv and more space. On arrival staff showed us around and were informative and friendly. The room was kept clean each day and was very relaxing. Breakfast and service was excellent, a good range of food although it did not change each day , this was not a problem for us. Staff were attentive and informative on any query. There is free Internet and computer use. The area the hotel is situated is near the main tourist attractions and resturants. It was in a quiet area and safe to walk around at night. I would give this hotel 5 out of 5

Reviews.Title: “We Recommend The Celal Sultan Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BassettHound33
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed for a week at the Celal Sultan. The location was perfect, in the Sultanahmet District between the Blue Mosque and the Haghia Sofia. The hotel was clean and attractively decorated. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The breakfast, although it did not vary much, had plenty of choice. Overall, we would highly recommend this hotel, probably more for couples and families with teenagers rather than famiies with young children.
